title: Brooke Boney 'fears she has made a big mistake' by jumping ship from Triple J to the Today show
text:
She's the former Triple J radio presenter who made the move over to the Today show in December, last year.

But jumping ship may well be more than what Brooke Boney bargained for.

According to Woman's Day, the 32-year-old 'wonders if she made a mistake' by moving over to Channel Nine as an entertainment reporter for the breakfast TV show because she is often criticised.

Having second thoughts? Reports have claimed that Brooke Boney 'fears she has made a big mistake' by jumping ship from Triple J to struggling Today show

However, the journalist, who describes herself as an 'all round legend' in her Instagram biography, doesn't seem too phased by the new reports.

Brooke stepped out for the 2020 Nine Upfronts earlier this month looking happier than ever.

She stunned at the event in a silk blue jacket with a belt and a matching trousers.

In December last year, it was announced the ABC news reader would be replacing Entertainment veteran Richard Wilkins after 25 years in the role.

Richard was then redeployed to second-tier show Today Extra, but has remained the entertainment editor at Nine.

And if reports are anything to by, the Today show could see another shake up on the network, with reports that Georgie Gardner could replace Sonia Kruger in 2020.

Happy as a clam: However, the Australian journalist who describes herself as an 'all round legend' in her Instagram biography doesn't seem too phased by the new reports, looking happy at the Nine 2020 Upfronts on October 16

However, a Nine spokesperson said on Sunday morning: 'All of the talk is made up.'

In a statement to Daily Mail Australia, the Nine spokesperson added: 'The sustained attack by The Sunday Telegraph on the female presenters of Nine is aimed to damage the standing of some of Australia’s most talented women in the media.

'Working mums Georgie Gardner, Erin Molan, Sonia Kruger and Deborah Knight are just some of the Nine women who are performing great roles across the various parts of the business, yet have been targeted by The Sunday Telegraph in a shameful onslaught of stories.'
description: She's the former Triple J radio presenter who made the move over to the Today show in December, last year.
authors: Ali Daher For Daily Mail Australia
